intro: Stilago, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy environments. They are characterized by their distinctive blue or purple flowers, which are often surrounded by bracts that resemble leaves. Stilago species are known for their ability to thrive in harsh, maritime conditions. Their unique morphology and ecological adaptations make them an important component of coastal flora.
